benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search/{searchKey} - Search custom fields

covered: Valid request / happy path: Basic successful retrieval is covered (TC01, TC22) and response body asserted as JSON array.
Pagination: limit/offset behavior (page slicing, minimal and large limits, offset beyond range) is exercised (TC02, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC28).
Audit parameter handling: FULL, MINIMAL, NONE and combinations with pagination/defaults are tested (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC28, TC29).
Query parameter validation: malformed and invalid values for limit/offset/audit and unsupported query parameters are tested (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC14).
Empty / no-match scenarios: empty JSON array responses are covered (TC06, TC09).
Authentication negative paths: missing and invalid token scenarios are present and expect 401 (TC15, TC16).
Error conditions: backend unavailable and unsupported HTTP method are covered (TC17 -> 503, TC30 -> 405) and input validation errors expecting 4xx are present (TC11-TC14).
Security & input edge-cases: XSS/injection attempts, Unicode, whitespace, empty and very long searchKey boundary tests are present (TC18, TC21, TC25, TC26, TC27).
Performance & concurrency: stress (large dataset) and concurrent request scenarios are included (TC19, TC20).
Integration & documentation concerns: integration consistency and API docs/error message accessibility are included (TC23, TC24).
gaps: Caching behavior not tested: no assertions for Content-Type, Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified, If-None-Match/304 behavior.
Rate limiting / throttling absent: there are no tests that verify how the API behaves under rapid repeated requests (429, Retry-After).
Authorization coverage incomplete: tests cover authentication failure (401) but not authorization/permission scenarios (403) or role-based access control.
Response headers not asserted: the acceptance criteria specifies application/json but tests do not assert Content-Type, charset, or other important headers.
Schema/contract validation missing: tests assert "JSON array of CustomField objects" but do not validate object schema/fields/types/required properties per the CustomField definition.
Ambiguous acceptance assertions: several scenarios allow "200 or 400 depending on business rules" (TC18, TC21, TC25, TC26) — this makes tests non-deterministic and hard to automate.
Server error (500) behavior not covered: no scenario simulates internal server errors (DB failure, unexpected exception) and checks 500 handling.
Numeric boundary / overflow cases: no tests for values beyond int64 or service-imposed maxima for limit/offset, nor for extremely large numeric inputs that could overflow parsers.
Path encoding/reserved characters: handling of percent-encoding or reserved characters (e.g., slashes) in the path parameter is not explicitly tested.
Pagination ordering and determinism not asserted: tests do not assert sorting/stable ordering across pages (which is important for correct pagination).
Error response schema and message consistency not validated: negative tests check status codes but not the structure/fields of the error payload.
Content negotiation / Accept header: behaviour when Accept header is missing/unsupported not covered, nor are HEAD/OPTIONS/CORS behaviors fully checked (TC30 only covers POST).
recommendations: Add caching tests: assert Content-Type: application/json; add tests for Cache-Control and ETag; test conditional GET (If-None-Match) to expect 304 when unchanged.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: fire bursts of requests to verify 429 responses and presence of Retry-After header, and include these in performance/regressions suites.
Add authorization (403) tests: create users/clients with insufficient privileges and assert 403 responses where applicable; clarify authentication vs authorization behavior in the API contract.

Add strict schema/contract assertions: validate each returned CustomField object against the API definition (#/definitions/CustomField), including types and required properties and audit sub-objects for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE.
Remove ambiguous expectations: decide business rules for empty/whitespace/very-long/searchKey and update Gherkin to assert the single expected status and payload to make tests deterministic.
Add server-error simulation: inject DB/service failure to assert 500 handling and that the error payload follows the standard error schema.
Add numeric boundary tests: include limit/offset values that exceed int64 and service maxima to assert 400/appropriate error handling, and test zero/edge values explicitly.
Add URL-encoding tests for path parameter: include reserved characters (/, ?, %, &, +) and assert they are correctly interpreted (or rejected) per spec.
Assert pagination ordering and stability: define and assert the sort order (e.g., by createdDate or id) and verify that pagination returns a stable, non-overlapping sequence of records.
Validate error payloads: for each negative case assert consistent error schema and meaningful human-readable messages (and appropriate machine-readable error codes).
Add content-negotiation and additional method tests: verify Accept header behavior, add HEAD/OPTIONS tests and ensure CORS/allowed-method responses are correct.
Make performance SLA explicit: codify acceptable response-time thresholds for stress tests and run them as part of CI where practical.
